name: UCLA or USC: Which School? Online Trivia | College Alumni | 20 Questions

questions.text: Did Freddie Mitchell, drafted by the Philadelphia Eagles, attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	Mitchell was the 25th pick in the 1st round in 2001.

questions.text: Did Skip Hicks attend UCLA?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The Washington Redskins drafted Hicks in the 3rd round in 1998.

questions.text: Did Keyshawn Johnson attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The New York Jets drafted Johnson in the 1st round in 1996. After his rookie season with the Jets, he came out with a controversial book called "Just Give Me The Damn Ball".

questions.text: Did Jonathan Ogden attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Baltimore Ravens drafted Ogden in the 1st round in 1996. Ogden played with the Ravens in Super Bowl XXXV. The Ravens beat the N.Y. Giants 34-7 on January 28, 2001 in Tampa, Florida.

questions.text: Ronnie Lott, drafted by the 49ers in 1981, attended USC?
questions.explanation:
True.

	The San Francisco 49ers drafted Lott in the 1st round in 1981. Known for his hard-hitting style, Lott impressed the 49ers coaching staff so much during his first day in training camp he was immediately named the starting left cornerback. That same season, he led a young secondary that helped the 49ers defeat the Cincinnati Bengals 26-21 in Super Bowl XVI in 1982. Lott also played for the Los Angeles Raiders and ended his career with the New York Jets.

questions.text: Did Anthony Munoz attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The Cincinnati Bengals drafted Munoz in the 1st round in 1980. Munoz was enshrined in the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1998. He started at tackle in Super Bowls XVI and XXIII, was All-Pro for 11 consecutive years and was selected to the NFL's 75th Anniversary All-Time Team in 1994.

questions.text: Did Tony Boselli attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The Jacksonville Jaguars drafted Boselli in the 1st round in 1995. Boselli has been a consensus All-Pro choice as the top offensive tackle in the NFL. Considered by many to be the best offensive lineman in the league. Boselli was the first draft choice by two expansion teams. The first team was the Jaguars in 1995 and the second team was the Houston Texans in 2002.

questions.text: J.J. Stokes first attended USC his freshman year, then transferred to UCLA after his sophomore year at USC.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The San Francisco 49ers drafted Stokes in the 1st round in 1995. Stokes did attend UCLA all four years of his eligibility. He completed his four-year career as UCLA's all-time leading receiver with 154 receptions for 2,469 yards and 28 touchdowns. He also was the first 49ers receiver selected in the first round of the NFL Draft since Jerry Rice in 1985.

questions.text: Did Daylon McCutcheon, drafted by the Browns in 1999, attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The Cleveland Browns drafted McCutcheon in the 3rd round in 1999.

questions.text: Did Jamir Miller attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Arizona Cardinals drafted Miller in the 1st round in 1994. In 1999, the Cleveland Browns signed him as an unrestricted free agent.

questions.text: Did Tommy Maddox attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Denver Broncos drafted Maddox in the 1st round in 1992.

questions.text: Did Eric Turner attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Cleveland Browns drafted Turner in the 1st round in 1991.

questions.text: Did Troy Aikman attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Dallas Cowboys drafted Aikman in the 1st round in 1989. Aikman played his entire career with the Cowboys, winning three Super Bowls during his tenure. The Super Bowl victories came in Super Bowl XXVII against the Buffalo Bills, again in XXVII against the Buffalo Bills, and XXIV against the Pittsburgh Steelers.

questions.text: Did Marcus Allen attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The Oakland Raiders drafted Allen in the 1st round in 1982. Who can forget Allen's incredible 74-yard touchdown run against the Washington Redskins in the Raiders lopsided 35-10 victory in Super Bowl XVII in Tampa, Florida.

questions.text: Lynn Swann attended USC?
questions.explanation:
True.

	The Pittsburgh Steelers drafted Swann in the 1st round in 1974. Swann electrified the Super Bowl X crowd the his MVP performing four receptions for 161 yards and a touchdown in the Steelers 21-17 win over the Dallas Cowboys at the Orange Bowl in Miami, Florida in 1976.

questions.text: Did Ken Norton, Jr. attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The Dallas Cowboys drafted Norton. Norton is the son of former heavyweight champion Ken Norton Sr. Norton, Jr. also played for the San Francisco 49ers.

questions.text: Did Ron Yary attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	Yary joined the Minnesota Vikings as the first player chosen in the 1968 AFL-NFL draft. His 15-season, 207-game career included 14 years with the Vikings from 1968 to 1981 and a final season with the Los Angeles Rams in 1982. The 6-5, 255-pound Yary possessed speed, agility, intelligence, aggressiveness, a hard work ethic and size; all attributes necessary to be an outstanding offensive lineman. Yary played in Super Bowls IV, VIII, IX and XI.

questions.text: Did Junior Seau attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	The San Diego Chargers drafted Seau in 1990. Seau was a unanimous first-team All-America in his third year at USC after recording 19 sacks and 27 tackles behind the line of scrimmage.

questions.text: Did Randy Cross attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
UCLA.

	The San Francisco 49ers drafted Cross in the 2nd round in 1976. Cross was the starting center for the years that the 49ers Super Bowl victories under the leadership of Hall of Fame quarterback Joe Montana.

questions.text: Did Ricky Bell attend UCLA or USC?
questions.explanation:
USC.

	Bell was nicknamed "Bulldog" by his teammates at USC. Bell was the Tampa Bay Buccaneers first draft choice in the 1977 NFL draft. He led the Buccaneers to the 1979 NFC Championship Game by rushing for 1,263 yards. Bell was traded to the San Diego Chargers in 1982, but played in only two games. Bell announced his retirement in 1983 because he was suffering from a rare muscle disease. Bell contracted the disease dermatomyositis and a degenerative disease of the heart muscle called cardiomyopathy. In 1984, he died of a heart attack at the age of 29.
